intro: Sclerolinon digynum, commonly known as the two-flowered rockrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, pink or white flowers. Sclerolinon digynum is often found in coastal or mountainous regions where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
